interaction_default: ^It seems like you're hanging out in the default scene.
^Just so you're aware, this is for bug testing.
^Sky really likes little things like to help figure things out

default: ^I think you - you didnt set a proper stitch?
^Idk to each their own , just take it away now.

b: ^Well, what do you make of it, Detective?
^It all points to an intruder, yeah. Whoever made the noise complaint probably heard something legit.
^The plot thickens!! Shall we check inside?

s1: ^ What are you looking at me for? I thought you were the expert.

b: ^It's good to see you too, Uncle.
^Meh. Not very good. But I am used to it by now.
^We're just asking a few questions about a disturbance last night.
^Of course, in anyway that I can.
^Feel free to look around, if it helps any.

personal_info: ^Well, I was born and raised here in Kettle Rock.
^When my parent's moved away, he became my guardian.
^I begged and begged for Misra to leave, too.
^A young person like yourself should be out there,
^Not here, where things move at a snails pace.
town_history: ^As I'm sure you've noticed, it's not in the best shape.
^Lots of places shutting down, going out of business.
^I think it's just unsustainable as it is.
^I know you don't like to hear it, but it's the truth.
^You stepped up as Sheriff once the rest of the force retired to take care of this place
^but it seems to me like it might be time to move on.
^Someone's got to try and turn things around.
winery_closing: ^Ah, the straw that broke the camels back.
^It finally shut down, about a month ago.
^I have no idea what will become of it.
^There are only so many things you can do with an old Winery.

b: ^Other than the abandoned Winery, the environment is kinda pretty...
^You have a perfect view of the Winery from here.
^It's not much to look at these days.
^Did you...see anything out of place, last night?
^We're investigating a break in that happened.
^Ay, Misra, you should not be poking around up there.
^Did you see anything last night, Uncle?
^Any ideas on who would want to break in and trash the place?

merch_shirt: ^Really leaning into that small town appeal, I see.
^Believe it or not, those used to fly off the shelves.
^I'd sell out of them one month, and then by the month after, I couldn't pay people to touch them.
merch_sticker: ^I feel like you'd need witchcraft to get these things to sell.

c-0: ^Dios Mio; that was a hard time.
^Although I'd argue that we've fallen on harder times now.
^So optimistic, and I love you for that.
^The Rocky Years was a time of inconsistency.
^We would flourish for the first part of the decade and struggle the latter.
^Disease of an unexplained nature swept through town.
^It was. I do not miss that time.
c-1: ^Folk around here speak ill of them, but don't listen.
^Certain people even like to gossip, call them names,
^insinuate that there was something else going on.
^Nothing real, and nothing worth talking about.
c-2: ^The Winery sales were good, tourism was up.
^people recovered from whatever mysterious disease had passed over us.
^It was a good time, but it's over now.
^For now. Good times will come again!
^Sometimes, the good times are just behind us.

b: ^I just need something to go off of.
^I'd say those troublemakers down at the Arcade.

teenagers: ^We spoke to the teens at Power Up.
^Jenny still giving you a hard time?
^They denied having anything to do with the Winery.
^They did point us towards a "Jenkins Tomm".
^I'm not sure he'll be any help to you.
^Really, Misra, I think you two should leave this alone.
^We've got to get to the bottom of this!

s0: ^Ugh! I just lost the level. I've got to focus, leave me alone.

b: ^And I'm not the one blocking you from your high score.
^I wanted to learn a little more about the town.
^I can tell when someone's lying, you know.
^I just want to ask you a few questions.
^You're still mad about the HO:SI thing?

KR_Jenny: ^Small ass town in the middle of nowhere.
^I noticed that there's not too many people around.
^Yeah, all the sane people have moved away in the last few years.
^but she isn't sure where we would go.
^Eh. This town is full of crazies and people stuck in denial.
winery_jenny: ^It seemed kinda important, to like, the town.
^I mean, the stupid Goats sure liked it up there.

b: ^Someone told us that you guys like to hang around up there.
^You know, I have knack for when someone's not telling me the whole truth, too.
^I've never set foot inside that place.

jenny_suspects: ^Say I wanted to learn more about the Winery...anyone been talking about it lately?

b: ^Can you, uh, speak a little slower?

calvin_questions: ^Do you like living in Kettle Rock?
cal_hosi: ^Do you play as the, erm, Snake Invaders?
^The Snake Invaders are the bad guys.
^I don't like being the bad guy.
personal_info_calvin: ^I used to go to school here, too, until Kettle Rock Junior High shut down.
^I tried out for soccer but didn't make the team.
winery_calvin: ^It's probably haunted or cursed or something.
^It was always closed, open, bankrupt, making money, then losing money, on and on.
^And the stupid Goats were always up there, too.

b: ^Someone said you maybe were up at the Winery?

KR_calvin: ^Not much to do other than game and--
calvin_sus: ^but I need you to tell me who should be.
^Who do you think would've been at the Winery last night?

s1: ^ YOU DON'T WANT TO SEE MY SICK MOVES

^I can just talk to your friends, then.

wine_josh: ^What does that have to do with anything?

hosi: ^They've been trying to beat it for a while now.
^What does that have to do with anything?
^It's the only game in here they don't have the high score on.

b: ^Do we really have to come back here...

b: ^You wouldn't have happened to go up there recently?

s0: ^Can't you let a tired man sleep?
s1: ^ God, my head is killing me. Oh wait. It's just the sound of your voice.

b: ^These folks have some questions for you.
^I ain't got nothin to say to the Rookie Sheriff.
^You answer their questions or I'm closing your tab.
^The hell do you want to know?

jenkins_questions: ^Were you at the Winery last night?
jenkins_winery_: ^Will I ever stop hearing about the godforsaken place?
^S'worth nothing but the dirt it stands on.
jenkins_last_night: ^You haven't been up there lately, then?
^I'm reminded of 'em everytime I set foot in the building.
^I feel like I can still hear them...
jenkins_kettle_rock: ^All that blood sunk into this town.
^All that blood turned into fleeting money.
^Was it worth it, do you think?
jenkins_council: ^The Council was s'much more than that.
^Their sacrifice s'not somethin to throw away,
jenkins_sarah: ^End of the line, ship s'goin down.
^I-I don't know who you're talking about.
jenkins_sacrifice: ^That's the second time I've heard that word tossed around. Are you talking about the people who vanished? The ..Council?
^That's what this town slaps over the truth.
^We're starting to pick up some steam with this.

irene_intro_cutscene: ^Let me know if you need anything.

b: ^What do you know about the Winery?

irene_goats: ^People have been mentioning Goats a lot.
^I get the feeling they're not talking about the animal.
^Misra, you haven't filled them in on this?
^If it's important to the case, I should know.
^The people who disappeared in the tragedy.
^It's just silly town folklore meant to scare kids and give people a reason to gossip.
^They call them "Goats" because people think they sacrificied themselves.
irene_plaque: ^I'll clean it off when I close up.
irene_sacrifice: ^Who better to be interested in a small town mystery than a Detective?
^That's not the case we're working on, though.
^I'm sure Misra's told you about Kettle Rock's rocky past?
^Well, legend says that in order to save the town, in desperation, a group of locals turned to darker alternatives.
^I don't know if they were dancin' with the Devil,
^or one of the many demons that want to sink their fangs into humanity's naive nature,
^but they were in kahoots with something of that nature.
^And one day in 1940, when it came time to pay up and face the music...
^I feel like you've given that speech before.
^Hey, I gotta keep the drunks entertained somehow.
irene_kettle_rock: ^I actually when to highschool with Misra.
^But I'm sure you know that already.
irene_winery: ^Sheesh, that old shack on the hill?
^More trouble than it's worth, in my opinion.
^There was a break in, it looks like.
^Heck, what are you talking to me for?
^You should be talking to Jenkins over there.
^He worked at that place for years.
^Would he have any reason to go up there and trash the place?
^Hell, I don't know. But I can tell you he's been here every night for the past week. Hasn't budged from his Whiskey Neat.
^But why don't you ask him yourselves?
^Give him a good shove, and he'll come to.
^I've done it a dozen times when he passes out like this.
irene_still_standing: ^Despite all the closed shops and stores, this place is still open.
^It's a little concerning that the bar is one of
^the businesses that is still able to stay afloat.
^People need somewhere to forget about their troubles, I guess.
^To be honest, I've been debating closing up shop myself.
^Yeah; Roy offered to buy me out.
^Says he'll pay me up front for the place, too.
^I'm not the only person he's made this offer too.
^He bought out the Diner, I'm pretty sure.

scene1_0: ^You've reached Chief Detective Inspector Thelton, Boise Precinct.
^I'm not available right now. You know what to do!
^Hey, it's Lupe. Had to change my route;
^I pit stopped outside of Kettle Rock, Idaho.
^Should be back on the road soon
^don't jump on me for being late.
^I'll debrief the Watchowski Case with you when I get back.

b: ^"Sorry I was so late to the debrief boss, I had to go report a suspicious fallen tree."
^Ugh. Guess I'll be more than a little late...
^Thelton's gonna kill me. Gah. Let's blow this popsicle stand.
^That noise didn't sound good. I should probably see what's up.
^"Out of order. Pay inside." Of course. Just my luck.
^Let's get this over with. Sooner I pay, sooner I can get back on the road, sooner Thelton won't bite my head off.
^... Why am I still looking at this gas pump?
^.. This gas pump is kind of freaky.
^I should really go pay for gas.

enter_store: ^I guess I'll find someone to help me inside here.

s0: ^Sugar-Flavored Snack Bites. Pickle Chips. Jerkied Ox Sticks...I think I'll pass.

b: ^Mel said to hit it. In the side.
^I work at a gas station. How do you think I am?
^...The pump's broken. It says to pay inside?
^Yeahhhhh. You can't pay right now. The register drawer is busted
^Oh he's not using it just cleaning some weird thing.
^I've got no reason to poke around.
^Mel's the name. What are you doing in here?
^I need to pay for gas. The cash register is broken.
^The drawer is just jammed, it just needs to be whacked in the side a bit.
^No idea, it was here when I unlocked this morning.

s0: ^Look, I'd like to help more, but I gotta get this stuff out.
s2: ^ It almost looks like mold? Or jello. Gross, ain't it?
s3: ^ I love my job. I love my job. Ugh.

b: ^"Sorry I was so late to the debrief boss, I had to go report a suspicious fallen tree." Ugh. Guess I'll be more than a little late...Thelton's gonna kill me.
^That noise didn't sound good. I should probably see what's up.

fallen_tree: ^Timber. Heh heh. Hope you didn't need to be anywhere anytime soon.
^...great. Any way I can get this fixed?
^If you put in a complaint with the local Police
^I'm sure you'll be out of here in no time.

scene2_DS: ^ You open the door to the precinct and are met with... no one. The place is frozen in time, with dust collecting on the window sills.

ding: ^You ding the bell and no one responds.
soul: ^Is there a single person in this town that's helpful?
^ First the gas station pump, now no sheriff? This place is a mess.
^"Hmph... well can't say I didn't try. I'm wasting my time here anywa-"
^"Sorry for the wait! We're a bit understaffed."
^"You almost gave me a heart attack!"
chastise: ^Their words stutter from holding back a laugh.
^ You roll your eyes in slight frustration.
^"And to whom do I owe the pleasure of almost sending into cardiac arrest?"
scared: ^"Oh really? I must have been confused then."
^"I don't understand spanish, but last I checked 'AYE! DIOS MIO!' means scared."
^ You can't help but roll your eyes at their sarcastic, and inaccurate, impression of you.
^"I wasn't scared. Just surprised. That's all."
^"Well, does this fearless person have a name?"
introductions: ^"Sheriff Misra! Nice to meet you, Lupe!"
silence: ^You attempt to ignore that they've already decided to drop your title as "Detective" and shake their hand.
niceToMeet: ^You grab their hand, and they give a vigorous shake that jolts up to your shoulder.
^Despite how much it bothers you, you attempt to ignore that they've already decided to drop your title as "Detective".
precinct: ^"So, what's the issue? Normally folks don't come here just to chit-chat."
Company: ^"Not here, and I'm not opposed to some company."
^Your train of thought scatters for a brief moment with a slight flutter of your heart rate.
treeFell: ^"There's a tree blocking the road out of town by the gas station. I need it cleared as soon as possible."
^ Well, I'll call the tree people and get that cleared out."
^"Yeah, the people who take care of the trees!"
^ Tree people...great. Just need to hope they can somehow call the right maintenance.
^"May take a while though! As you may have noticed, we don't have many people who can help around here. "

b: ^  Looks like we might get to know each other after all."

treeFell: ^"Let me see what I can do for you!"
^They excuse themselves to make the call.
^There has to be something to do around here.
snoop: ^You lean over the front desk to see where the Sheriff went, but they're nowhere to be seen.
^They probably entered a different room to make the call.
^What you do see, however, is a manilla folder with a label...
^The curiosity in the back of your mind calls for you to take just a quick look. Who can resist an unsolved mystery?
peek: ^You quietly reach over the front desk and take a look at the case.
^You realize that case is an overstatement for what's in this folder.
^ Where did they come from?! You could've sworn that you were keeping an eye over your shoulder.
^"You CAN'T keep scaring me like that."
^They're going to give you a headache.
^"I'd also like to point out you probably just broke some kind of law."
^You try to hand the file back to them, but they push it towards your direction.
^"No! No worries, 'Detective'! You didn't answer my question..."
wait: ^You may be bored out of your mind, but not crazy enough to go snooping around a precinct.
^Even if it's incredibly boring here, it would be bad if you're caught looking into other case files. Expecially outside of your jurisdiction.
^You continue waiting, and after what feels like an eternity, the Sheriff returns.
^"Yep, as expected! They said it'll take a while."
solo: ^"Yup! At the moment it's just me!"
^"When are the other staff or patrol Units coming?"
transition_to_case: ^"Well, since you're going to be here a while, 'Detective', I could use your help!"
^"Yeah! We got a bit of a cold-case going on."
^They hand you a thin manilla folder.
time: ^"It's hard to say. The time tends to range between a couple hours to a couple...days."
^"Yeah. Things happen a lot...slower here in Kettle Rock. But don't worry! I'll make sure they know it's urgent."
^ You're going to die of boredom here if you need to spend hours...no...DAYS doing nothing in the middle of nowhere.
nothingHere: ^"I mean this isn't a case. This is a bunch of bull-"
^"No, no. The case is right there! What else is there supposed to be?"
^"Oh, I don't know. Maybe the actual problem you're trying to solve."
^"Or anything else pertaining to the case."
^"I mean, there's some stuff here, sure, but it's flimsy."
^"Yeah, I just didn't know what goes into a case file. "
^"How long have you been a Sheriff?"
^"And no one is here to help you?"
^ Somehow this poor sheriff is going to go nowhere with this supposed "cold case"
^ It's not really that complex of a case, truly. Just find who made the phone call and learn why.
^ You've solved much more nearly-impossible cases. The fact that they're tied up on this is...baffling.
Evidence: ^"Well for starters, evidence. You're not sure who placed this call, so any clues will narrow down suspects."
^"So we go to the Winery and look around!"
Witnesses: ^"Well for starters, witnesses. If something was going down, someone must have heard or seen something."
^"So go into town and ask people!"
^"No. First go to the crime scene, see what evidence you can gather before questioning."
Help: ^"What you need is someone to help you on this case. You're too fresh to handle a case on your own."
We: ^"Yeah! I mean what else are you going to do in the meantime? "
^"Come on! What if reality hangs in the balance, and we must figure this out to save the world!! Woaaaahhhh!!! It's your destinyyyyyyyy!"
^ They do have a point. What are you going to do in the meanwhile?
^ Sit at the bar and stare at the walls?
^ It shouldn't be too hard, and may keep you occupied while the "tree people" arrive.
^"Let me just make a quick call first."

b: ^ grab your phone and begin to

phone_call: ^"You've reached Chief Detective Inspector Thelton, Boise Precinct. I'm not available right now. You know what to do."

b: ^"Thelton, Lupe here. Currently stuck in Kettle Rock. Should be back in Dafenport by tomorrow morning. I'll keep you updated."
^ times!! Currently stuck in Kettle Rock. I'll keep you updated."
^"The better question is when is she not."
^"...How'd you know I called my Chief?"

voicemail: ^"Well I'm going to need to see this place itself. Can't really figure out much from this file alone."
^They spring out from behind the desk, jokingly gesturing towards the door.
JokeBack: ^That slight joke may have drained your social battery for the week.
^Misra giggles as they walk out the door
^"Alright! Misra and Lupe on the case! Watch out Kettle Rock, we gon'na figure you OUT!"
door: ^You walk through the door, not saying a word to Misra.
^"Alright! Misra and Lupe on the case! Watch out Kettle Rock, we gon'na figure you OUT!"

intro: ^Here we are! Kettle Rock's pride and joy. Best wine north of California.
^You said this place closed a few weeks ago? It looks like it's been abandoned for years.
^Well, it has been a bit neglected recently. But make no mistake, this is a piece of town history!

b: ^Seems like the fence has been cut through. That gap looks just big enough for a person...

window: ^Hm. I'd say this is a pretty solid piece of evidence.
^Yeah, it's definitely been broken by force. But something about this seems off to me...

b: ^Maybe they didn't want to leave shoe prints?
^Footprints at the scene of the crime. Classic.
^It's obscure. Someone was definitely here, but I can't speak to motive. Who would want to break into an abandoned Winery?
^That sounds like it's time for some profiling! We need a suspect list.
^Any leads on who it could be?
^Our best bet is questioning some locals.
^Oh, right! Yeah, of course you don't.
^I can give you directions in the car.
^Wow. The inside is so much better than the outside.
^Never judge a book by it's cover!
^That was sarcasm, you know that, right?

inside_window: ^Something about this broken window doesn't make sense to me...
handprint: ^Well, someone didn't care about leaving behind evidence.
^Do you have a lab here in Kettle Rock?
claw_marks: ^Some kind of animal, maybe? Maybe a raccoon is our culprit.
floor_splatters: ^I know what you're thinking! Don't worry, it's not blood. I'm sure you've already deduced this, but it's dried up wine from when this place was used.
equipment: ^Some of this stuff looks like it's been ripped apart.
wine_barrels: ^Back in the day, this place really did make good wine.
^Is any of that wine left in there?
^Are you asking if I want to get a drink?
^...It would just be a motive, if anyone was looking to take some.
^Oh, no. They drained all of it when the Winery closed.
^I don't drink when I'm on a case.
^I know, I know. Professional, as always.
door_office: ^To one of the backrooms. It was locked when the Winery shut down, and is still locked.
^So they wouldn't have been able to access that room?

b: ^We probably shouldn't leave just yet! More investigating to do!

scene4_1: ^Lupe and Misra find themselves on the Main Street of Kettle Rock, in front of a Fountain.
^The General Store and Arcade are accessible.
^Any store marked with a closed sign is not accessible.

misra_cutscene_afternoon: ^Kettle Rock, Main Street. Heart of the Downtown.

s0: ^Your park job, may I say, is impeccable!
s1: ^ Hot wheels for a hot...let's continue.

^Beside, tickets aren't that bad around here, anyway.

^I deal with intense people all the time.
^I'm not afraid of whoever is in there.

s1: ^ I don't think it's anything important.

b: ^Hm. Looks like some sort of silly engravement.

b: ^ And let out a light puff of air from your nose

b: ^"Not as predictable as you may think!"

RoyQuestions: ^"Sounds like Roy's buisness isn't doing too well."
^"Roy sure knows alot about this town."
close: ^"Most definately! He took me under his wing when my parents left."
^"No worries! They're not dead or anything like that."
^"They just moved over to Montana, that's all!"
^"Seems like you're doing well on your own."
yourOwn: ^"I don't know where I'd be without him!"
old: ^"Oh! Oh they didn't abandoned me as a child or anything like that!"
^"Don't worry, my backstory isn't THAT tragic!"
^"Seems like you're doing well on your own."
leaveWithThem: ^"Because I still have hope for this town."
^"People keep leaving, thinking that this is some sort of crazy downfall."
^"No way! There has to be some way to get back on our feet. Kettle Rock has done it multiple times in the past, and we can do it again!"
^"Even if I have to be the only person working towards that, then so be it."
^"I just wish more people cared about our home, you know?"
^"You know what, we'll recover! I just know it!!"
buisness: ^"Things have been rather rough around here, even for him. But...I don't know."
^"We're not really the most wealthy town, at least not anymore."
^"But he's offering to buy out buisnesses?"
itsAlright: ^"It's alright! We'll get back on our feet eventually!"
buyOut: ^"Or maybe...maybe he's just trying to help us."
^ They break eye contact for a brief moment, attemping to blink away the tears at the edge of their eyes.
^"Maybe he's the richest man in town and we don't know it!!"
town: ^"Oh yeah!! He's been here a long time."
^"Actually, he's been here his whole life!"
^"I'm pretty sure him and his sister never traveled outside of Kettle Rock"
RoySister: ^"Yeah! She was a really nice lady!"
RoySisterExplination: ^"Well, she went missing alongside the other folks of the tragedy."
maybe: ^ There's a slight crack in their voice, and rapidly clear it before taking another sip of their drink.

Bachitan: ^"Are we talking monster legend? Or some other legend?"
^"Ha! No, there's no monsters in kettle Rock."
^"This town is so small you'd think someone would notice a monster by now!"

sacrifice: ^"Nope! The whole thing about a sacrifice is just a rumor to scare the kids."
club: ^"Kind of? I mean in a way I suppose cults are just more dangerous clubs."
prank: ^"I wish it was! Would be a very sad prank though."
legendExplination: ^"They say there was once some sort of 'council' in this town, though I don't know much about it myself."
^"Why not? Shouldn't you know more about this supposed 'council' to help the people?"
^"Well, people believe they're the cause of the disappearances. I'd rather leave those people be than poke into their buisness."

hometown2: ^"So you're not too far from home!"

b: ^"Oh boy! I'm not in any trouble, am I?"
^"Well now I'm going to keep my ears peeled to ensure you're not lying to me about anything."
^"Oh ok good! You haven't caught me yet!"
^"So your mind reading powers only apply to lies and not favorite colors?
^"That skill must be very useful for a detective, though!"

justTell: ^"Maybe we can find proof behind this accusation!"

WhatNow: ^"Alright, you've asked enough questions. My turn!"
^"I mean, you followed me all around town for a case you unltimately really don't have anything to gain from."

boredom: ^"Yeah...I mean there's not much else to do."

b: ^ They lightly hit you on the shoulder, causing a light laughter to escape.
^ They too begin to laugh, and something resonates within you.
^ You can't explain it but this feels...right.

nothing: ^"Yeah...yeah I suppose there really isn't much here."
theBet: ^"Oh come on! You can't leave me hanging like this!"
cocky: ^"I made a remark that I could solve any case tossed at me..."
^"And she wanted to place a bet that I could hold up that statement."

b: ^"Alright Sherlock, if you're so good at your job then what's the craziest case you've solved?"

shoe: ^"I once found a killer with the only evidence being a single shoe print"
^"Really? I'd like to see you try."
toothbrush: ^"I once found a missing person because she had shared a toothbrush with her kidnapper."
^"Yeah...sometimes this line of work can get gross."
dogCollar: ^"I once found a missing person based off a dog collar in the woods."
^"Oh! Was it because of their dog...?"
^"Yeah, they're alive but it was an...odd relationship between the kidnappee and abductor."
^"I'm curious to know more, but I don't think I want to know."
^ You give a thousand-yard stare into your glass.
^"Curiosity is good, but sometimes can put us in bad situations."
^"Oh yeah, I know a thing or two about that!"
lose: ^"So, what would happen if you lose?"
^"First off, I'd become a laughing stock in my department."
^"Secondly, I'd have to buy coffee for her for a whole year."
company: ^ The words fall out of your mouth almost naturally.
^ Even though you had just met them, it's as though a weight is lifted off your chest letting those words out.
^"If I'm going to be stuck here...I don't know."
whatNowContinue: ^"Are we ready to crack this case right open!?"
NotEvenClose: ^"We have scattered evidence, but nothing to latch onto."
KiddingMe: ^"We only have loose ends, but nothing concrete."
Stakeout: ^"But we've already asked everyone around town! What else is there to do?"
stationCars: ^"I may or may not have lost the keys..."

b: ^  "Alright, alright don't get too excited. This is a one-time thing."
^  "Sure, whatever you say! I call the radio station though!"
^ You pay the tab for both your drink and Misra's, then head out.
^ You pay your tab, Misra pays for theirs, and you both leave the bar.

scene5_1_DS: ^ You sit in the car in silence, keeping a close eye on the winery.
^"This is alot more boring than the movies."

usedToIt: ^"Get used to it. Detectives do this alot."
^"Can we at least put on some music?"
music: ^ Misra immedinately turns on the radio and adjusts it to a station. A chirpy radio broadcaster's voice blasts through the car before you turn down the volume.
^"This is 99.7! Here with the latest hit from Britney Smears!"
^ The station erupts with sound effects before the song plays.
^"I love Britney Smears! How about you?"
^"What?! Ok, then what kind of music do you listen to?"
classical: ^"Then what's your favorite song? Beethoven the 28th?"
^"So who do you think we're going to see in the winery?"
pop: ^"So you do listen to pop but never heard of Britney Smears?"

b: ^  "Only a little bit, you've redeemed your slightly cool status!"

youCool: ^"So who do you think we're going to see in the winery?"

b: ^ Although you offered to turn it on, maybe it was a lapse in judgement.
^ Seeing Misra with their eyes closed, humming gleefully to the music, makes you hesitate for a moment...

turnOffRadio: ^"We need to remain quiet. The perpetrator can't know we're here if we want this to work."
^"So who do you think we're going to see?"

goats: ^"Maybe. It's a shot in the dark but it's a possibility."
^"By the way, 'goats' is an insulting name to those who disappeared."
^"It's best to not call them that."
^"Why does Kettle Rock have an insult for missing people?"

didntKnowBetter: ^"It's alright, you didn't know any better!"
^"I mean there have been many terms tossed around."
^"Cult is a strong term, but I guess..."
^"Yeah you could consider them a cult..."
insulted: ^"Actually, it's more like people want to believe they were insane to give reasoning behind their disappearances."
^"And were they not? They sounded like some sort of cult."

b: ^ "I'm sorry if I'm overstepping, just trying to get an understanding in case if this pertains to the case."

misguided: ^"People here have a tendency to talk on their behalf after the tragedy..."
^"And I've heard through the grapevine that the council was convinced that their sacrifice would bring prosperity back to Kettle Rock."
^"And what? Do you believe that they set some sort of curse?"
yeah: ^"I'm not much for magic, but who knows what's out there?"
Preserving: ^"But if what you say is true, there's a possibility that the remaining members of this supposed 'council' is trying to preserve the town."
^"And maybe their 'preservation methods' has something to do with this winery."

b: ^ "Yeah! Sure! Let me just quickly get the KoolAid!"

Preserving: ^"If we did find some way to help out little ol' Kettle Rock, that could be nice."
couldBe: ^"Could be. You all seem like lovely people."
^"Yeah. Alot of us here are just looking for a quiet place to call home. You know?"
^"And I wish you all the best."
realistic: ^"Seems like 'little ol' Kettle Rock' has had

b: ^ "Ha ha! I see what you did there."

leave2: ^"Curse or not, I understand why people are leaving."
^"Seems like citizens here are struggling these days."
^"So it makes sense if they would like to look for...something better?"
^"Even if this place is our home?"
^"Yeah, even if they consider this place home."
strangeQuestion: ^"If your home was going through a hard time, would you leave?"
homeYes: ^"It's not pleasent, but sometimes things happen."
scary: ^"Change is scary because it's a dive into the unknown that most people are not willing to take..."
hard: ^"Change is hard because you have to willingly accept it before you can move on..."
normal: ^"Change is normal. As absurd as it sounds, it's just a part of life we have no control over."
preSound: ^"But it's what's needed to progress life towards something better."
^"Well is this change necessary? I mean it feels like everyone's running for the hills when we can be-"
homeNo: ^"Maybe I'm having some sort of deja vu..."
^"Somethings been strange since I've first stepped foot in this town."

b: ^ "Maybe all three at the same time."
^ "I don't think they have enough arms to do that!"
^ "Can I ask you a strange question?"

RuhRoah: ^ A sudden crash from within the winery causes you to jump nearly out of your seat.
^ You look to Misra for some sort of answer; but they are silent and there is a terror that dwells in their eyes as they grab ahold of their flashlight.
^ They take a deep sigh, holding their tears in.
^ They hold it up with trembling hands before suddenly bolting out of the car.
^"Misra, what are you doing?! Get back here!"
^ You rapidly unbuckle your seatbelt to follow.

fence: ^I can't leave, I have to find Misra.
window: ^Ugh, I can't see inside, it's too dark.
strange_footsteps: ^Whoever left these here...are they here again?

handprint: ^How could Misra run off like that?
^Someone dangerous could be hiding in here...
wine_barrels: ^This place is somehow even more creepy at night...
goop: ^God, more of this gunk. It reeks - smells like vinegar.

read_newspaper: ^Well, that's depressing. Seems like the Winery closing was the last straw.
winery_graph: ^This place has really seen some bad days.
^I've never seen profit be this erratic and inconsistent.

s0: ^No, no, no--Misra's got to be here somewhere.

locked_door: ^Was this just all a bit for you to scare me again?
^I don't know what that noise was.
^So I took the opportunity to spook ya.
^Splitting up like that is a rookie move.
^But if this wasn't all a joke, then what about the noises?
^Was probably just the wind or something.

scene7_1_DS: ^ You open the door to the precinct and are met with... no one.
^ A memory begins to arise from the back of your mind.
^ And an overwhelming feeling of...Deja Vu?
^ To have Deja Vu, you would've had to have been here before.
^ You know there has to be someone here with you.

ding: ^You ding the bell, but no one responds.
name: ev
/ev
^name:Lupe
^emote : Lupe | Inquistive_1
^"MISRA!!"
^name: Misra
^emote : Misra | Curious_1
^"Um...hey?"
^"Do I...uh..know you?"
^name: Lupe
^emote : Lupe | Fright_1
^"Y-yeah. But.. but.."
^name: Lupe
^"H-how?!"
soul: ^ Deep down, you know for a fact there is someone here.
^"Sorry for the wait! We're a bit understaffed."
^"You almost gave me a heart attack!"
chastise: ^Their words stutter from holding back a laugh.
^"And to whom do I owe the pleasure of almost sending into cardiac arrest?"
scared: ^"Oh really? I must have been confused then."
^"I don't understand spanish, but last I checked 'AYE! DIOS MIO!' means scared."
^"I wasn't scared. Just surprised. That's all."
^"Well, does this fearless person have a name?"
niceToMeet: ^You grab their hand, and give an unexpected shake
^Despite how much it bothers you, you attempt to ignore that they've already decided to drop your title as "Detective".
^"Oh! Ok, cutting straight to the point I guess!"
precinct: ^"So, what's the issue? Normally folks don't come here just to chit-chat."
Company: ^"Not here, and I'm not opposed to some company."
^Your train of thought scatters for a brief moment with the slight raise of your heart rate.
treeFell: ^"There's a tree blocking the road out of town by the gas station. I need it cleared as soon as possible."
^ Well, I'll call the tree people and get that cleared out."
^"May take a while though! As you may have noticed, we don't have many people who can help around here. "

b: ^  Looks like we might get to know each other after all."

treeFell: ^They excuse themselves to make the call.
^There has to be something to do around here.
snoop: ^You lean over the front desk to see where the Sheriff went, but they're nowhere to be seen. They probably entered a different room to make the call.
^What you do see, however, is a manilla folder with a label...
^The curiosity in the back of your mind calls for you to take just a quick look.
^ You feel a memory tug at the back of your mind.
^ You know what's going to be in here.
peek: ^You quietly reach over the front desk and take a look at the case.
^You realize that case is an overstatement for what's in this folder.
^ You look up, meeting eyes with Misra.
wait: ^You may be bored out of your mind, but not crazy enough to go snooping around a precinct.
^Even if it's incredibly barren here, it would look bad on your record if you're caught looking into other case files. Expecially outside of your jurisdiction.
^Besides, Misra is just around the corner. They'll probably spot you if you start snooping.
^"Yep, as expected! They said it'll take a while."
solo: ^"Yup! At the moment it's just me!"
^"When are the other staff or patrol Units coming?"
transition_to_case: ^"Well, since you're going to be here a while, 'Detective', I could use your help!"
^"Yeah! We got a bit of a cold-case going on."
^They hand you a thin manilla folder.
time: ^"It's hard to say. The time tends to range between-"
^"Well, things happen a lot...slower here in Kettle Rock. But don't worry! I'll make sure they know it's urgent."
nothingHere: ^"I mean this isn't a case. This is a bunch of bull-"
^"No, no. The case is right there! What else is there supposed to be?"
^"Oh, I don't know. Maybe the actual problem you're trying to solve."
^"Or anything else pertaining to the case."
^"I mean, there's some stuff there, sure, but it's flimsy."
^"Yeah, I just didn't know what goes into a case file. "
^"How long have you been a Sheriff?"
Evidence: ^"Well for starters, evidence. You're not sure who placed this call, so any clues will narrow down suspects."
^"So we go to the Winery and look around!"
Witnesses: ^"Well for starters, witnesses. If something was going down, someone must have heard or seen something."
^"So go into town and ask people!"
^"No. First go to the crime scene, see what evidence you can gather before questioning."
Help: ^"What you need is someone to help you on this case. You're too fresh to handle a cold case."
We: ^"Yeah! I mean what else are you going to do in the meantime?"
^"Find out what's going on in that damn winery."

voicemail: ^"Thelton, Lupe here. Currently stuck in Kettle Rock..."

^"With the winery up on the hill."
^"It's just a hunch, or a weird feeling, or....well, I don't know."

^"...and if any of their last known locations are connected to that winery."
^"I'd...greatly appreciate it if you could call back. Thanks."

intro: ^You've reached Chief Detective Inspector Thelton, Boise Precinct.
^I'm not available right now. You know what to do!
^Hey...it's Lupe. Had to change my route; tank was running low.
^I pit stopped outside of Kettle Rock, Idaho.
^Hoping to get back on the road soon...sorry,
^Don't jump on me for being late.
^I'll debrief the Watchowski Case with you when I get back.

b: ^Timber. Heh heh. Hope you didn't need to be anywhere anytime soon.
^...yeah....should I...head down to the precinct to file a complaint?
^You're stuck at the pump too, eh?
^Good luck getting that lazybones to help you.
^Heh. Youth these days, am I right?
^Something tells me I'll be here longer than I think. I should probably try Thelton again at some point.
^That noise didn't sound good. I should probably see what's up.

s0: ^God, I feel weird. The Deja Vu is killing me right now.
s1: ^ Alright. Let's get this over with.
s2: ^ I hope it doesn't take too long.
